title:
Enhanced stability and chaotic condensates in multi-species
  non-reciprocal mixtures
authors: Laya Parkavousi, Navdeep Rana, Ramin Golestanian, Suropriya Saha
abstract:
Random non-reciprocal interactions between a large number of conserved
densities are shown to enhance the stability of the system towards pattern
formation. The enhanced stability is an exact result when the number of species
approaches infinity and is confirmed numerically by simulations of the
multi-species non-reciprocal Cahn-Hilliard model. Furthermore, the diversity in
dynamical patterns increases with increasing number of components and novel
steady states such as pulsating or spatiotemporally chaotic condensates are
observed. Our results may help to unravel the mechanisms by which living
systems self-organise via metabolism.
